definition: to have a style of one's own
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: During the course, WANG Bin-bin has obtained certain achievement and formed his unique style in the contemporary literature critics.
sentences.chinese: 他取得了一定的成就，在當代文學批評中自成一家。

sentences.english: Xu Wei's"freehand ink"painting techniques for the bird, spectacular dreams of.
sentences.chinese: 徐渭的潑墨寫意花鳥畫，別開生面自成一家。

sentences.english: Because he is a poet of independent.
sentences.chinese: 因爲他是一個自成一家的詞人。

definition: lit. to fly one's banner on a solitary tree (idiom); fig. to act as a loner/to stand out/to develop one's own school/to have attitude of one's own
stick-in-the-mud/to stick to old ways/stubbornly conservative
lit. spirit and marrow/the essential character
four famous Song calligraphers, namely: Su Shi 蘇軾|苏轼[Su1 Shi4], Huang Tingjian 黃庭堅|黄庭坚[Huang2 Ting2 jian1], Mi Fu 米芾[Mi3 Fu2] and Cai Xiang 蔡襄[Cai4 Xiang1]
Mi Fu (1051-1107), Song poet and calligrapher
following the ways of old/in imitation of ancient style
